alert.note: Alert for Chester; Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 2:51PM EDT until July 25 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Pottstown, Elverson, Cedarville, Pughtown, Gilbertsville, Stowe, Spring City, Kenilworth, South Pottstown, Pottsgrove, Sanatoga, and Halfway House. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 301 and 304. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
